pr_title: [#1390] Allow for custom parameters to be provided when triggering a reset

timeline.message:
Introduce ResetMessage

Introduce a ResetMessage plus implementation to support resetting with
an optional payload field

#1390

Add prepare reset with reset info

Add a prepareReset(R resetInfo) method to open up the provisioning of
reset-supporting information

#1390

Add prepare reset with reset info

Add a prepareReset(R resetInfo) method to open up the provisioning of
reset-supporting information

#1390

Change ResetHandler annotation

Change the ResetHandler annotation to  specifically cope with message of
 type ResetMessage instead of EventMessages containing the
 ResetTriggeredEvent

#1390

Add resetTokens methods allowing reset-info

Create additional resetTokens methods which take a resetInfo parameter.
The resetInfo parameter should be provided to the EventHandlerInvoker

Adjust default implementation of perform/prepareReset

The original performReset()/prepareReset() should no default to the new
implementation, as users might have implemented these methods themselves
Instead, the new method should call the old impl., if the reset context
is null. Otherwise, throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
Additionally, keep the old overrides, which call the new method, thus
ensuring users which use these interfaces directly still have the same
functionality too.

#1390

Drop ResetTriggeredEvent

Drop ResetTriggeredEvent, as it's no longer used and wouldn't be used by
 users.

#1390

Rename ResetMessage to ResetContext and let it implement Message again

ResetContext better carries the load of what the dedicated reset Message
 is for, hence it should be renamed. Additionally, letting it implement
 event mean introduces a form of premature optimization, as it requires
 a dedicated ResetHandlingMember where the priority method is overridden
Additionally, a timestamp on a ResetMessage doesn't say much, as the
reset's time is always when it occurs
